$!You must tell DVLA if you have Alzheimer’s disease.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don't tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you're involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

## Car, motorcycle, bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form CG1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D[Download 'CG1 - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 276KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_171291.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}$D 

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA if you have Alzheimer's disease
title: Alzheimer's disease and driving
